com.github.naoghuman.lib.preferences.core

Interface PreferencesFactory.FirstStep

  • Enclosing class:
    PreferencesFactory

    public static interface PreferencesFactory.FirstStep
    In this first step the developer have the possibility to activate the application or the module scope for this factory.

    The different between both scopes is that

    • the used key in the application scope from the next SecondStep must be unique in the hole application.
    • while the key in the module scope from the next SecondStep must be unique in a package scope.
    See the JavaDoc commenary from both methods in this interface for more information.
    Since:
    0.6.0
    Version:
    0.6.0
    Author:
    Naoghuman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PreferencesFactory.SecondStep application()
      Activates the application scope.
      PreferencesFactory.SecondStep module(Class clazz)
      Activates the module scope.

    • Method Detail

      • application

        PreferencesFactory.SecondStep application()
        Activates the application scope.

        In context from this scope a key, which allows to access or store a value into the Properties, must be unique in the hole application.
        To accomplish this behavior this method adds automatically the prefix from the class DefaultPreferences to the given key.

        Returns:
        the next step in this factory: SecondStep
        Since:
        0.6.0
        See Also:
        DefaultPreferences.key(String), Properties

      • module

        PreferencesFactory.SecondStep module(Class clazz)
        Activates the module scope.

        In context from this scope a key, which allows to access or store a value from / into the Properties, must be unique in a package scope.
        To accomplish this behavior this method adds automatically the package name from the clazz to the given key.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the package name from this Class defines the module scope.
        Returns:
        the next step in this factory: SecondStep
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if (clazz == NULL).
        Since:
        0.6.0
        See Also:
        DefaultPreferences.key(String), DefaultPreferencesValidator.requireNonNull(java.lang.Object), NullPointerException, Properties
